resource.name: Annual Air Quality Index (AQI) from 2011 to 2015
resource.description: Annual AQI data for Fulton county and benchmark counties. The number of days under each AQI air quality condition for each year is summarized.

resource.name: JRI: Monthly Superior Court Case Filings by Case Type
resource.description: A count of the monthly case filings to Fulton County Superior Court by case type.
columns_description: Total number of criminal filings in Superior Court

resource.name: Law Enforcement Clearance Rates
resource.description: Clearance rate for Part 1 crimes for law enforcement agencies in Fulton County.  Includes police departments for ten out of fourteen police departments.  Clearance rates were not reported by Johns Creek, Milton, Chattahoochee Hills and Sandy Springs.
resource.attribution: FBI (as reported by National Public Radio)

resource.name: JRI: Percent Misdemeanors Accused within Time Standard
resource.description: The monthly percentage of misdemeanor arrests that result in an accusation within 30, 60 and 90 days.  In-custody and out-of-custody cases are provided separately.

resource.name: Jail Report: Bookings and Releases
resource.description: The number of monthly inmate bookings into and releases from Fulton County detention facilities including the main jail.

resource.name: Fulton Department Performance Measures 2
columns_description: Is the Bonus Programs?
Year and quarter of measurement
Is the KPI currently active?

resource.name: Strategic Performance Measures
resource.description: Complete set of strategic-level performance measures with current and historic metric values.
resource.attribution: Fulton County Strategy and Performance Management Office
columns_description: The strategic priority area with which the performance indicator is associated.
The description of the performance indicator.
The unit in which the indicator value is expressed.  For example, dollars, minutes, etc.
The frequency at which the performance indicator is updated.
The margin of error associated with the corresponding measurement value.
A description of calculations used to derive the measure from the source data.
An indicator of the most recent set of data.
The place or geographic unit to which the metric value applies.
The short name of the performance indicator.
A category term used to enable grouping of metric values for the purpose of reporting and graphically displaying performance measure data.
The type of measure used for the performance indicator.  For example, count, percentage, currency, etc.
Unique ID for each performance indicator.
Indicates whether the measure is actively being tracked.
The quantity assigned to the performance measure for the corresponding metric date.
The source of the data used to quantify the performance measure.

resource.name: Percent of Court Cases Disposed within Time Standard
resource.description: The monthly percent of court cases disposed within time standards segmented by case type (felony, misdemeanor, civil).

resource.name: JRI: Percent Felonies Indicted within Time Standard
resource.description: The percent of Fulton County felony cases indicted within 30, 60 and 90 days.  Percentages are given for all felonies, in-custody felonies, out-of-custody felonies, complex cases and non-complex cases.
columns_description: Date representing the month over which the indictments are summarized.  Used primarily for generating time trend graphs,

resource.name: National Benchmark Violent Crime Summary
resource.description: A summary of benchmark county violent crime rates including annual lowest, highest and median rates among the benchmark counties.  Annual Fulton County rates are included for comparison,
columns_name: County with Highest Violent Crime Rate
County with Lowest Violent Crime Rate
Fulton County Violent Crime Rate per 100,000

resource.name: Code Violation Self Resolution
resource.description: This dataset provides the percentage of code violations that are resolved by the owner by the time of the first re-inspection.  Percentages are calculated and reported quarterly.

resource.name: Jail Report: Inmates Released After180 and 365 Days
resource.description: The number of inmates released monthly from Fulton County detention facilities after remaining in jail for over 180 and 365 days.

resource.name: Ryan White Performance Measures
resource.description: Department performance measures for the Fulton County Ryan White Program

resource.name: Development Authority Performance Measures
resource.description: Departmental performance measures for the department of Development Authority

resource.name: JRI: Re-Arrest Rates
resource.description: The percentage of individual arrested in a given month who are arrested again within 12 months.
columns_name: Percent Rearrested within 12 Months of Release

resource.name: Public Works Transportation Performance Measures
resource.description: Departmental performance measures for the Department of Public Works (transportation)

resource.name: City of Atlanta Crime Incidents
resource.description: The dataset consists of reported crime incidents in the City of Atlanta for the years 2016 and 2017.  The data are made publically available by the City of Atlanta Police Department.  Some data fields in the original data have been removed because they were more applicable to internal use than public use.  The fields Crime Category and Crime Class were added.  The values in those two fields represent two levels of grouping of the Crime Type.

resource.name: Emergency Response Times
resource.description: This data set represents the average response time for emergency vehicles.  Average response times have been calculated for each agency (Police, Fire and EMS), quarter of the year and call priority.  This data set contains response time only for Fulton County agencies serving the unincorporated part of the county.

resource.name: JRI: Average Jail Population
resource.description: The average inmate population at all Fulton County detention facilities including the Main Jail.  The average population is calculated for each month by averaging the daily population counts reported by the Fulton County Sheriff.

resource.name: Jail Report: Average Length of Stay
DCRC Spreadsheet
resource.description: All measures on DCRC report up until "RA avg days to close"

resource.name: Jail Report: Days Before Release
resource.description: The number of days jail detainees have spent in jail at the time of their release categorized by ranges (0 to 1, 2 to 7, etc.).  Includes values for felony and misdemeanor detainees separately and combined.

resource.name: Business Code Violations
resource.description: This data set represents the number of code violations reported on commercial properties per 1,000 commercial properties in the unincorporated part of Fulton County.
